audience: Individuals and organizations seeking to enhance productivity and knowledge management

sections.intent: Hook the audience and establish context
keyPoints: Introduce Muse as a revolutionary tool for thought management
Highlight the importance of capturing and utilizing ideas effectively
Mention the inspiration behind the product and its development
Humans have ~6,200 thoughts/day, with many unrecorded
72% of people experience ephemeral ideas that go uncaptured
The average employee wastes ~1.8 hours/day searching for information they've seen before

sections.intent: Present Muse as the solution to the identified problem
keyPoints: Muse acts as a Thought Garden, transforming passive note-taking into proactive knowledge creation
Utilizes proprietary LLMs and user-specific embeddings for enhanced understanding
Creates deliverables and synthesizes insights from notes
Smart Surfacing: understands the context behind queries and notes
Analyzes notes in relation to each other for better retrieval
Proactively generates content like documents, playlists, and flashcards

sections.intent: Highlight the potential market for Muse
keyPoints: Growing demand for productivity tools in both personal and professional settings
Significant costs associated with lost productivity due to poor note management
Opportunity to capture a share of the knowledge management market
